001 package de.pali.transliteration;

003 import java.util.HashMap;

005 import de.general.transliteration.ITransliterator;
006 
007 public class PaliDevanagariToHarvardKyoto implements ITransliterator {
008     private static final HashMap<String, String> map;
009     static {
010         map = new HashMap<String, String>();
011         map.put("à¤…","a");
012         map.put("à¤†","A");

096 
097     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
098     // Methods
099     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
100 
101     @Override
102     public String fromSchema()
103     {
104         return "DEV";
105     }
106 
107     @Override
108     public String toSchema()
109     {
110         return "HKC";
111     }
112 
113     @Override
114     public String transliterate(String text)
115     {
116         StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
117         String[] a = text.split("");
118         
119         for (int i = 1; i < a.length; i++) {
120             String c = a[i];
121             String x = map.get(c);
122             if (x != null) {
123                 sb.append(x);
124                 if ((i+1 < a.length) && isConsonant(c) && isConsonant(a[i+1])) {
125                     sb.append("a");
126                 }
127             } else {
128                 sb.append(c);
129             }
130         }
131         if (isConsonant(a[a.length-1])) {
132             sb.append("a");
133         }
134         return sb.toString();
135     }   
136     
137     private boolean isConsonant(String devLetter) {
138         return map.get(devLetter).matches("[^iueoaIUEOA]+");
139     }
140 }
